				}

						href="javascript:void(0);">Skip to Main Content</a></div>
				<script type="text/javascript">
					document.getElementById('skipToMainContentLink').addEventListener('click', function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
    var mainContentElement = jQuery('#container').first();
    jQuery('html, body').animate({
      scrollTop: (mainContentElement.offset().top)
    }, 500);
    // We can only focus a div if it has a tab index value. Set it to -1 so that we can focus it but we can't
    // tab to it and so we don't disrupt the normal tab navigation flow
    mainContentElement.attr('tabindex',-1).focus();
});
				</script>

window.displaySearchFormHeader = true
window.trackGoal = function trackGoal(goalName) {
  if(window.analytics) {
    if (window.debug_abtest_tracking) { console.log('Tracking goal: ', goalName); }

    window.analytics.track(
      'track_goal',
      { goal_name: goalName },
      function (err) { if(err) console.log(err); }
    );
  }
};

window.trackGoalOnce = function trackGoalOnce(goalName) {
  if (!window.abtestGoalTracked[goalName]) {
    window.abtestGoalTracked[goalName] = true;
    window.trackGoal(goalName);
  }
}

};

  onClick: function allMetrosLinkClicked() {
    var url = '/all-metros';
    if(true){
      window.trackGoal('header_allMetrosLink_click');

    window.open(url, '_blank');

};

  onClick: function promoBannerClicked() {
    var url = 'https://blog.opentable.com/support-restaurants/';

    window.trackGoal(eventName);
    window.OTDataLayer.push({
      event: eventName
    })
    window.open(url, '_blank');
  }
}

													<div class="" style="line-height:24px">
														<div>Please call us for Thanksgiving Day reservations and
															details at (313) 253-4475.
															<br />TRIA - An American Brasserie offers inspired cuisine uniquely prepared and presented in a casual and engaging atmosphere. The seasonal American menu highlights local and sustainable foods. Specialties include the Henry Burger with farm egg and crisp pancetta and  the "Chef's Daily Chalkboard"  featuring seasonal Michigan ingredients . More than 12 items on the menu are Gluten Free!<br /><br />TRIA also features a rotation of Michigan beers on tap and a seasonal cocktail menu that explores the flavors that we feel best represent Michigan.  To celebrate the grape and our award winning wine list, TRIA has assembled more than 35 wines by the glass available in four sizes, including an 8 oz quartino meant for sharing.<br /><br />Taste. Savor. Share.</div>

																<script>
																	window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary = {
  params: {"rid":62737,"culture":"en-US","includeCSS":true,"anonymousId":"9CAA25D4-61CC-4DE9-AFA2-9912C77DCDC0"},
  href: "https://oc-registry.opentable.com/v2/oc-reviews-restaurant-profile-summary/1.1.2447"
};
window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.bind = function() {
  window.oc = window.oc || {};
  window.oc.cmd = oc.cmd || [];
  oc.cmd.push(function() {
    var $ = oc.$;

    var $component = $('oc-component[data-name=\'oc-reviews-restaurant-profile-summary\']');
    if ($component.attr('data-events-bound')) {
      return;
    }

    function updateComponent() {
      var newHref = window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.href + '?' + $.param(window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.params);
      if (newHref !== $component.attr('href')) {
        oc.renderByHref(newHref, function(err, result) {
          if (!err) {
            $component.attr('href', newHref);
            $component.html(result.html);
          }
        });
      }
    }

    $(document).on('touchstart, click', function(e) {
      var $reviewOverallRatingContainer = $('.reviewOverallRatingIcon:first');
      var $basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo = $('.basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo:visible:first');
      if ($basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo.length && (!$.contains($basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo, e.target) || !$.contains($reviewOverallRatingContainer, e.target))) {
        $basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo.hide();
      }
    });

    $(document).on('touchstart, click', '.reviewOverallRatingIcon', function() {
      $('.basedOnAllTimeRatingsInfo').toggle();
      return false;
    });

    $(document).on('click', '#scrollToTopLink', function(e){
      e.preventDefault();
      $("html, body").animate({ scrollTop: 0 }, "fast");
      return false;
    });

    $(window).on('resize scroll', function() {
      var $summaryComponent = $('oc-component[data-name=\'oc-reviews-restaurant-profile-summary\']');

      // sometimes this query fails but is intermittent because of the "rerender" at updateComponent
      // let's ignore the event calls when it would fail
      var offsets = $summaryComponent.offset();
      if (!$summaryComponent.length || !offsets) {
        return;
      }

      var topOfElement = offsets.top;
      var bottomOfElement = offsets.top + $summaryComponent.outerHeight();
      var bottomOfScreen = $(window).scrollTop() + window.innerHeight;
      var topOfScreen = $(window).scrollTop();

      if ((bottomOfScreen > topOfElement) && (topOfScreen < bottomOfElement)) {
        if (window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.updating || window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.params.bucketABTests)
          return;
        window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.updating = true;
        window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.params.bucketABTests = true;
        updateComponent();
      }
    });
    $component.attr('data-events-bound', true);
  });
}
window.ocReviewsRestaurantProfileSummary.bind();
																</script>
																<script>
																	window.oc=window.oc||{};oc.renderedComponents=oc.renderedComponents||{};oc.renderedComponents["oc-reviews-restaurant-profile-summary"]="1.1.2447";
																</script>
															</oc-component>

																			$(function() {
  $('#reviewSortBtn').click(function(){
    $(this).attr("aria-expanded", function(_, attrValue) {
      return attrValue === "true" ? "false" : "true";
    });
  });

  $("#reviewSortBtn").focusout(function() {
    $(this).attr("aria-expanded", "false");

																						was unattentive to our high top
																						table in the bar. We first
																						ordered wine and water while we
																						were looking at the menu on the
																						iPad. Brought the 2 glasses of
																						wine. No water. Watched her
																						talking behind bar to other help
																						instead of concentrating on her
																						tables. Not crowded. At Tria
																						other food servers brought out
																						our Caesar salad. Had to ask
																						them for the bread basket. Our
																						waitress never.came back once
																						she inputed our order into
																						computer. Our wine glasses sat
																						empty for a least 5 minutes
																						until I marched up to the bar
																						where she was talking and doing
																						nothing to order 2 more glasses
																						of wine. Quite pricey for that
																						kind of service. Our wines were
																						$16.00 per glass for 8 oz. I
																						have been there numerous times
																						but was disappointed with the
																						service. My husband told the
																						manager when we left and if she
																						was doing her job she would have
																						noticed us sitting there getting
																						No attention.</p>

																							<span class="oc-reviews-47b8de40">Dined on February 8, 2020</span>
																						</div>
																					</div>
																					<div class="oc-reviews-0d90fee7">
																						<span class="oc-reviews-ec85707c">Overall</span><span class="oc-reviews-e3e61235">3</span><span class="oc-reviews-ec85707c">food</span><span class="oc-reviews-e3e61235">2</span><span class="oc-reviews-ec85707c">service</span><span class="oc-reviews-e3e61235">4</span><span class="oc-reviews-ec85707c">ambience</span><span class="oc-reviews-e3e61235">5</span>
																					</div>
																				</div>
																				<div data-clamp="3"
																					id="review-body-container-OT-62737-2109949143-100035990200"
																					class="reviewBodyContainer oc-reviews-8107696f">
																					<p id="review-body-original-OT-62737-2109949143-100035990200"
																						lang="en-US" style="">Great
																						ambiance, lovely decor. Our
																						appetizer was delicious, roasted
																						elephant garlic. However, we
																						were both disappointed in the
																						entrees we ordered. My husband
																						ordered the Mahi Mahi, he said
																						the taste was fine but the size
																						was lacking for the price. <br />I ordered the French onion soup, modern Waldorf salad and added a grilledchicken breast. The French onion soup had a good taste, but the amount of bread in the bowl was crazy. It was like eating a loaf of soggy bread, barely any liquid. The grilled chicken on top of the salad was perfectly cooked and tasty. The salad itself was a disappoint. The spinach was doused in dressing, something mixed in was extremely gritty, I couldn’t help but think I was eating dirt that wasn’t washed off the spinach greens. There were not any walnuts on my plate and the roasted grapes were not roasted, not at all what I expected.
																						<br />The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, but uninterested in any opinion I had on the meal. When he asked how the meal was, my response was “it was not great” he simply took my plate, still full of greens and moved on. Based off of this experience it is not a place I would go back to, to spend the amount of money they charge. Definitely put a damper on our date night.</p>

																					class="reviewBodyContainer oc-reviews-8107696f">
																					<p id="review-body-original-OT-62737-2109946488-170021061027"
																						lang="en-US" style="">There were
																						only a few occupied tables, yet
																						the service was exceptionally
																						slow. Our waitress spent too
																						much time talking with a
																						colleague versus attending to
																						her customers. I actually had to
																						get up and walk over to her and
																						ask her to return to our table
																						to take our lunch orders. I had
																						one guest who was a late arrival
																						and she didn’t even come over
																						immediately to take his drink
																						order. <br /><br />The food is good though some of the preparations are on the sweeter side. The Express Lunch is a great way to sample different offerings and is quite reasonable.
																						<br /><br />Service was fairly slow throughout our lunch experience. The waitress was not as attentive as she should have been.</p>

																						Excellent, roasted oysters, bone
																						in filet both
																						outstanding!<br />Host (Robert) very friendly and nice.<br />Waitress / bartender both friendly and provided timely service<br />The bar / restaurant manager however was extremely rude.  He ruined the weekend.  We left with my wife in tears.  I have never seen or heard anyone in hospitality business present themselves in such a despicable manner.  Regrettably we paid our bill and departed early because of his behavior.  I will not return and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants an enjoyable fun evening.</p>

						window.OT = window.OT || {};
window.OT.SRS = window.OT.SRS || {};
// NOTE: This was done for SEO purposes. See https://github.com/opentable/oc-core-components/pull/469
// The onclick handler prevents seo bots from going to certain links. `href="#"` a11y fix was added to links using
// the onClick event so that screen readers and assistive devices can properly tab to them while SEO bots see it
// as a self link and don't crawl to it.
var onLinkClick = function(url) {
  window.open(url, '_blank');
}

					<script>
						function blurActiveElement() {
    setTimeout(function() { document.activeElement.blur(); }, 0);
}

function OptanonWrapper() {
    var acceptButton = document.getElementById("onetrust-accept-btn-handler");
    var closeButton = document.getElementById("onetrust-close-btn-container");
    var modalAllowAllButton = document.getElementById("accept-recommended-btn-handler");
    var modalConfirmMyChoicesButton = document.getElementsByClassName("save-preference-btn-handler onetrust-close-btn-handler button-theme")[0];

    if (acceptButton) {
        acceptButton.addEventListener('click', blurActiveElement);
    }

    if (closeButton) {
        closeButton.addEventListener('click', blurActiveElement);
    }

    if (modalAllowAllButton) {
        modalAllowAllButton.addEventListener('click', blurActiveElement);
    }

    if (modalConfirmMyChoicesButton) {
        modalConfirmMyChoicesButton.addEventListener('click', blurActiveElement);
    }
}
					</script>

Named for the branding iron owned by the proprietor, the eight-anda-half acre Branding Iron Vineyard lies in western Oakville, close to the base of the Mayacamas Mountains. The vineyard is comprised of well-drained clay loam and the vines are vertically trellised to maximize sunlight and open the canopy. The area's warm climate and sun exposure in both the morning and afternoon is perfect for slowly ripening the fruit, which often benefits from a long hang time. With its bright red fruit and floral aromas complemented by a bouquet of clove, anise and cardamom, the 2017 Branding Iron Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon offers a beautiful balance of fresh fruit and spice. These old vineyards are planted at between 1,050 and 1,350 meters (approximately 3,445 and 4,430 ft) above sea level and have a naturally low yield (between 2 and 3 t/ha [0.81 and 1.22 t/acre]).
